item.title: BJ Fogg on the "motivation wave" and small wins
item.description: I have written about here previously about Stanford researcher BJ Fogg in the context of his "Tiny Habits" project. He has a talk here from 2012 about the "motivation wave" and how software and systems that are are looking to facilitate behavior change need to recognize that people have the ability to do hard things only every so often, and thus they need to build in structures that let people do easy things that are still on-task when their motivations are low. The challenge is to get people to do things when they are motivated that allow them to expand their capacity to be on task when they are not motivated, e.g. by making it possible for them to get small and easy wins and tiny successes when their personal motivation is at a low ebb.

item.title: a few brief words appropriate to our non-blogging friends on Twitter
item.description:
Brevity is the very soul of wit.  - Wm. Shakespeare.
I would have written something shorter if I had only had the time. - attrib Blaise Pascal, Mark Twain
I have a marvelous proof but the margins are too small to contain it.  Fermat's Last Theorem
Small is beautiful.  E. F. Schumacher via Leopold Kohr
Small wins are compact, tangible, upbeat, non-controversial, and relatively rare.  Karl Weick.
Think small.   DDB ad for Volkswagen
Less is more.  Ludwig Mies van der Rohe on minimalism
Reduce, reuse, recycle.
Get the little book!  E. B. White
Every little bit helps.

Smaller but bitter.  pin worn by University of Michigan workers downsized in 1980s budget cuts
Every little bit hurts.  Brenda Holloway; Funkadelic
